name: Alaska Beach House

reviews.title: DAD AND SONS FISHING GET AWAY
reviews.text: . I couldn’t let the experience you provided go without recognition. We were allowed to enter our room very early (5:30 am) without any previous encounters and found very creative and comfortable surroundings prepared, including breakfast, wireless internet, and cable TV (requirements for teenagers and would-be-relaxing businessmen). Even the teenagers were impressed with the attention to detail evident in the construction and furnishings. We had any questions and needs quickly and courteously procured and were grateful for the personal touches provided for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for facilitating a memorable visit to Homer.
reviews.title: LUNAR TIDES & A SMILING BRIDE !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: R Jones
reviews.title: Homer Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've enjoyed nearly a dozen trips to mainland Alaska over the past 10 years. It's my favorite place. This year the Beach House's Compass Rose is where we got married on the balcony. The lodging there is charming, the amenities great, and the people wonderful. I love watching Bald Eagles, but one sat in the spruce tree over our balcony for three days watching us. This iscertainly a place where one comes back again.
reviews.title: This stay was the highlight of our trip to Alaska.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Garre & Dru Anne Conner
reviews.title: Warm hospitality, relaxing privacy right on the beach in Homer, AK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a memorable time at the Beach House B&B. The Rose Compass Cabin was fabulous with a fantastic view and one of the most comfortable beds anywhere. Being able to wake up in the morning, roll over and look at the panoramic view of sea, sky and mountain was great. The huge TV and big comfy recliners were a great sight after being out fishing all day. The location was great - within minutes of restaurants and on the spit. Sue was gracious and so nice to finally meet. She was great with updates for all our questions in the months before we finally got here. We toured all the rooms and each one is unique and beautiful. Definetely a great find in Homer and we hope to return someday soon. Thanks, Sue.
reviews.title: Great view, beautiful cottage, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in many places during our week long visit to Alaska. Our three days at the Beach House B&B were by far the most relaxing. The owner, Sue, provided us with fresh, homebaked goodies every morning and the yogurt was a special touch for a Alaskan breakfast. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the view awesome.
reviews.title: More than we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wood fired hot tub was closed when we were there (off season), but we had a jacuzzi tub in the bath.
reviews.title: The Perfect Alaska Cottage - the Perfect Ocean and Mountain View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Compass Rose Quarters - a warm cozy cottage on the bluff overlooking Homer Spit and Kachemak Bay to the east . . . sweeping almost 180 degrees the west where Augustine volcano pokes its beautiful conical peak over the horizon some 70 miles in the distance. The emaculate cottage was perfect for our fall outing to see Alaskan seasonal colors. The amenities included a 36" flat screen TV, fast wireless internet, microwave, fridge, and a viewing deck just 25 feet over the waves of the Cook Inlet. Peaceful, serene, and comfortable in the crispy fall weather. Marie's hospitality included fresh baked banana bread each morning. There were no surprises . . . fully equipped and fully functional.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in June, 2009. We stayed in the Compass Rose Quarters and loved everything about it. The bed was large and comfortable, and the view was amazing. If you want to stay indoors, breakfast is brought to your room the day before and the lounge chairs are extremely comfortable for reading or watching the flat screen TV. If you go out, you are likely to see the moose that loves across the road or the eagle and porcupine which live on the premises. You are a quick 5 minutes from restaurants in town or the Spit. We really didn't want to check out.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience

reviews.text: One's satisfaction with the accomodations at this establishment depend entirely on which room you have (or, the cabin), and your ability to ignore the junk, such as rusting barbeques, fishing floats, nets, and kitsch that inhabits and surrounds the property, the occasional presence of relatives of cranky owners/operators of the Beach House, and the "add on" look and actual construction of the accomodations. The owners live in a tiny area in the front of the "buildings.". The walls are far from soundproof so the sounds of other guests and the owners are clearly audible. The rooms, viewed by this writer by invitation of other guests and from personal experience, vary from tiny to large. One has a "view" of the small dirt parking lot; another has the same view as well as, by standing up and craning your neck, of Kachemak Bay, on which the property is located above the beach, which you can walk down to on stairs; you can even stop part way and sit in a swimging law chair. These two rooms, in additin to being very small, are dark and full of nautical kitsch. There is a small refrigerator and a table and chairs but you have to wash your utensils in the bathroom sink. As with all the rooms, breakfast is provivded: muffins, juice, milk, sometimes fruit and/or yoghurt packets of hot cereal and hot chocolate. Two other rooms have entries from the side of the combined maze of buildings and are considered oceanview; they are a bit larger. The premier room is in the front and has a large picture window with an essentially unobstructed view of the Bay and mountains and glaciers beyond in both the front and side of the room. There is also a deck that extends the entire length of the front of the "buliding" with deck chairs. This room has a small refrigerator, microwave, table and chairs behind of of the pictureTV w/VCR/DVD, sofa, queen sized bed, and decent sized bathroom with a shower and jacuzzi tub. There is also a cozy one room cabin that is built into the side of the cliff which has an unobstructed view of the Bay, etc. There is a queen sized bed, large flat screen TV with DVD, two chairs for reading, a reading lamp, a small table ad two chairs behind one of the windows, a kitchen area wiht a small refrigeratora, microwave, and sink, and a medium sized bathroom with shower. Part of the grounds are grass and have a porch swing and plastic deck chairs at the eige for great views, though it is often windy. There is also a wood-fired wooden soaking hot tub that is available for use after 7pm with Bay,. etc. views in front of the owners' living room on the grass below the deck. The owners are not very friendly and seem interested solely in getting and keeping your money. They also don't seem to realize that the property is a mess and the descriptions of the rooms are misleading. All of the above comments were made by virtually every guest who stayed at this property.
reviews.title: An oceanfront setting amidst a jumble of junk and building add-ons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our Alaska Vacation Homer and the BeachHouse was our first stop. It set the tone for for our amazing vacation. The Beachhouse is fabulous. You really can hear the waves while you sleep. It was great. We were there from Sept 2-6 and we stayed in the Cpmpass Rose Quarters and it was breathtaking. The cottage is furnished with authentic charm. It had a handmade quilt covering the bed. My husband has a bad back and the bed was perfect. In the evenings we would watch the tide go out and watch the otters and seals play in the Bay. They have steps to the beach that goes down to the bay. My husband walks with a cane and he made it to the beach without problems. It was a great place to start a vacation. Sue makes the best homemade breads, for breakfast. She would have fresh fruit, her homemade bread, yogurt, Oatmeal and coffee and juice in the room ready for us to fix whenever we got up. It was a perfect setup. We could eat whenever we were ready and several mornings we were gone very early. There is a swing right at the waters edge just to sit and meditate.and watch for her eagles which we saw . What an amazing place they have . . The only thing I hated was leaving. It was truly spectacular. WE would reccommend the Beachhouse to anyone looking for a wonderful place to stay,
reviews.title: WE loved the Beachhouse B & B

reviews.text: I have been arranging corporate trips to Homer Alaska for six years now.
reviews.title: As comfortable as home!!!

likes.liked: — The proximity to the water and the rooms.
likes.disliked: — There was nothing not to like.

reviews.text: My Husband and I celebrated our 30th at the Beach House B&B. It was awesome and we plan on going back next year for our 31st!
reviews.title: Had a Blast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing view, excellent room, very quiet and peaceful and very clean! Beds were comfy cozy too!
reviews.title: Was I in Heaven?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reasonable rates and wonderful owners, what more could you ask for!
reviews.title: A piece of Heaven!!!!

reviews.text: Rick and Sue Clark
reviews.title: Outstanding Bed & Breakfast!

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in the Compass Rose Quarters. The view of Kachemak Bay was breath taking from our room. You could sit on your own private balconey overlooking the bay. Sooooo relaxing! Our room was very clean! The over stuffed recliners and room decor, made you feel like you were at home. Our kitchen was stocked with breakfast items. Sue always made homemade muffins/breads and they were delivered the night before. The problem was, they were so good that we would just eat them right away.
reviews.title: Awesome place

description: Outstanding luxury lodging located on the water's edge in Homer Alaska, Alaska Beach House. Enjoy the sights and sounds of the waves. We offer beach access, Free High Speed internet, TV, 2 BBQ's, fire pit (smores/hotdogs), mini Kitchenettes, private entrances and baths. Each room has a wonderful comfy bed for your nights rest, with deluxe linens. Our rooms offer a TV, coffee pot, refrigerator, microwave, hair dryer, and bath soap, for your convenience. Patio furniture for relaxing outside and viewing the bay and wildlife. We do not offer a breakfast.
